member.name: M:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.Components.RelatedItemOperationSequenceComponent.GetResponseCommerceEntity(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a CommerceEntity contained in the response object of the parent operation.
member.param: Name of the model expected to be in the response.
member.returns: Gets a CommerceEntity cast to type TItem
member.remarks: This method should only be used to get a CommerceEntity contained in the Response of the CreateOperation or the UpdateOperation. For any other operation this method will return null. Also, this method assumes that the UpdateOperationResponse onlty contains a single item. If the UpdateOperationResponse contains more than one or no items, then the InvalidOperationException is thrown. If the response object contains a CommerceEntity of the type that is not TItem type, then the UnsupportedTypeInResponseException is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.Components.RelatedItemOperationSequenceComponent.GetResponseCommerceEntities(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a collection of commerce entities contained in the response object of the parent operation.
member.returns: A collection of the commerce entities cast to type TItem
member.remarks: This method should only be used to get a CommerceEntity contained in the Response of the QueryOperation. For any other operation this method will return null. If the response object contains a CommerceEntity of the type that is not TItem type, then the UnsupportedTypeInResponseException is thrown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.Components.BasketLineItemsProcessorConfiguration.Rollup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to collapse duplicate lines. Controls the behavior of adding a line item where one already exists which has the same values for catalog, product Id and variant Id. If set to true, only the quantity of the new line item is used, and it is simply added to the existing line item's quantity. If set to false, the new line item is added to the end of the list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.Components.ShopperListLineItemsProcessorConfiguration.Rollup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to collapse duplicate lines. Controls the behavior of adding a line item where one already exists which has the same values for catalog, product Id and variant Id. If set to true, only the quantity of the new line item is used, and it is simply added to the existing line item's quantity. If set to false, the new line item is added to the end of the list.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.ContextProviders.NonShared.CommerceOrdersSectionHandler
member.summary: This class is designed to be used as the orders configuration section handler in the non-shared mode. In the none-shared mode, the Orders system configuration is stored in the ChannelConfiguration.config file, rather than in the web.config / app.config file. This class is intended to be specified in the web.config / app.config file in declaration of the orders section. The orders section itself can be specified as an empty node, since all the configuration will be derived from the ChannelConfiguration.config file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.StockStatus.Disabled
member.summary: The SKU is considered out of stock regardless of its current quantity; a fast way to temporarily stop a product from being sold.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.StockStatus.Enabled
member.summary: The SKU is determined to be in-stock or out of stock or back-ordered or pre-ordered depending on its quantity and Stock-Out Threshold.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.StockStatus.Ignored
member.summary: The SKU is bypassed by the inventory management system. It is treated as in-stock for display purposes and ordering. This allows gift certificates or other "infinite stock" products to be sold on the site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.InventoryCondition.Undefined
member.summary: Indicates the inventory condition has not been defined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.InventoryCondition.InStock
member.summary: Sku is in stock. The quantity is in stock to meet the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.InventoryCondition.Preordered
member.summary: Sku is pre-ordered. If a product or variant is considered pre-order by the inventory system it is always displayed and can be purchased on the site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.InventoryCondition.Backordered
member.summary: Sku is back-ordered. If a product or variant is considered on Back-Order by the inventory system it may not be shown, or be shown as Back-Ordered and not available or Back-Ordered but still available to order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.InventoryCondition.OutOfStock
member.summary: Sku is out of stock. When a SKU can no longer be sold due to quantity conditions, being disabled or if it’s missing (depending on the site configuration).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.BasketStatus.InProcess
member.summary: The basket is still being built. Totals are not ready for review.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.BasketStatus.ReadyForCheckout
member.summary: The basket totals are ready to be reviewed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.KnownModelConst.BasketStatus.Ordered
member.summary: The basket is ready to be converted to an order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.ContextProviders.CommerceSiteContexts.#cctor
member.summary:
Initializes static members of the CommerceSiteContexts class.
Performs initialization of contexts based on configuration. If configuration "ServiceConfiguration\@useSharedCommerceContexts" is "true", it will use providers that return the already instantiated contexts from Microsoft.CommerceServer.Runtime.CommerceContext.Current (works only in a Commerce Server enabled site and for the default site only). Otherwise, if the setting is "false", this class will use providers that create new contexts for any site requested (makes use of multi-channel configuration).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.Metadata.MetadataBlender
member.summary: This class is responsible for merging (blending) base metadata definitions with derived ones. For example, it allows to merge the metadata definitions from the default channel with the definitions provided in a specific channel on top of the base one.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Commerce.Providers.Metadata.MetadataBlender.Blend(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: This method merges the metadata found in the base object with the metadata in the derived one.
member.param: the object containing the base metadata
the object containing the derived metadata
member.returns: The metadata will be merged if both of the objects are of one of the following types: CommerceEntity, IDictionary or IList. If the objects are not of one of these types the derived object is returned. If one of the objects is null - the other one will be returned. null is returned if both objects are null.
member.exception: Thrown when the objects are not of the same type or the derivedObject type is not a subclass of the baseObject type.
